title: Flat Feet Fix: Rebuild the Arch
author: james-scott
description: Teach the foot to create its own support system. Essential for kids with 'collapsed' ankles and flat feet. Build the arch muscles that orthotics let sleep.
coachNote: James's Take: An orthotic is a crutch. It tells your foot 'go to sleep, I got this.' We want to WAKE the foot up. If your arch cramps during these exercises, you're doing it right—those muscles haven't worked in years.

steps.title: Short Foot (Seated)
steps.instruction: Sit with feet flat on floor. Keep ALL toes flat and relaxed. Now try to 'shorten' your foot by pulling the ball of your foot toward your heel. Your arch should dome up without your toes curling.

steps.title: Short Foot (Standing)
steps.instruction: Same as above but standing. This is much harder. Feel your arch lift while keeping toes flat on the ground. Hold each contraction for 5 seconds.

steps.title: Pen Pinches
steps.instruction: Place a pen under your arch while standing. Try to lift your arch high enough that you could slide the pen out—WITHOUT curling your toes or shifting weight.

steps.title: Toe Spreads
steps.instruction: Spread all 5 toes apart like a fan. Hold for 5 seconds. This activates the intrinsic foot muscles that support the arch from below.

coachingCues: TOES STAY FLAT—if they curl, you're cheating
Cramping is normal and means the muscles are working
Start seated, progress to standing only when you can control it
Do this barefoot on a hard surface for best feedback
commonMistake: Curling the toes to fake the arch lift
mistakeFix: Put a thin towel over your toes so you can't see them. Feel the arch lift from the MIDDLE of your foot, not the toes.
